page.title: 19Events
page.content: The Linslade/Soulbury area was plunged into the news in 1984 when a dangerous criminal nicknamed "The Fox" terrorised the area. He wore a balaclava so little description of him could be given. He started by breaking into local homes and stealing but soon escalated his activities by shooting owners of the houses when disturbed. He went on to rape several women. This caused absolute panic. Helicopters and extra police were drafted into the area. Local Do-It- Yourself shops sold out of security locks, alarms and safety devices and people were warned not to leave any windows open.The Fox was finally captured in London. In 1985 the National Westminster Bank was robbed of Â£100,000 by men dressed as security guards. No-one was hurt.
